summary: This is an FBI communication requesting the Newark/Trenton office to interview a federal inmate regarding information he claims to have about Jeffrey Epstein's involvement in the 1985 murder of attorney Arthur L. Shapiro. The document also summarizes the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, for attempting to sell a list of additional victims.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Previous house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell a list of additional Epstein victims for $50,000 to an undercover employee after being deposed in civil litigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Palm Beach County resident who brought underage girls to his home for massages and sex acts; pled guilty to state offenses via a non-prosecution agreement and was sentenced to prison and community supervision as a registered sex offender.

persons.name: Arthur L. Shapiro
persons.context: Murder victim from March 6, 1985; the case remains unsolved. A federal inmate claims Epstein was involved in his murder.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the house manager and butler for Epstein.
A federal inmate claims Epstein was involved in Shapiro's murder, though the document notes the inmate may have mental illness and the claim was not previously proffered.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Rodriguez Attempts to Sell Victim List
events.description: Rodriguez attempted to sell a list of additional Epstein victims to an undercover employee for $50,000.

events.title: Murder of Arthur L. Shapiro
events.description: Attorney Arthur L. Shapiro was killed in the Columbus, Ohio area; the case remains unsolved.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Begins
events.description: Miami Division began investigating Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, was charged with obstruction of justice for attempting to sell a list of additional victims for $50,000 after his deposition in civil litigation.
A federal inmate (name redacted) at FCI Fort Dix, serving time for a Ponzi scheme, claimed Jeffrey Epstein was involved in the 1985 murder of attorney Arthur L. Shapiro.
The document notes the inmate appears to have a history of mental illness and did not offer this information as a proffer during his own criminal case.
Jeffrey Epstein entered a non-prosecution agreement, pled guilty to state offenses, and was sentenced to prison followed by community supervision as a registered sex offender.
The FBI is requesting an interview with the federal inmate to assess his claims about Epstein's involvement in Shapiro's murder.
